00036 template <typename T, std::size_t R, std::size_t C, typename A = std::allocator<T> >
00037 class Matrix {
00038     public:
00039         // --------
00040         // typedefs
00041         // --------
00042         typedef A                 allocator_type;
00043         typedef Array<T, C, A>        value_type;
00044 
00045         typedef std::size_t       size_type;
00046         typedef std::ptrdiff_t    difference_type;
00047 
00048         typedef value_type*       pointer;
00049         typedef const value_type* const_pointer;
00050 
00051         typedef value_type&       reference;
00052         typedef const value_type& const_reference;
00053 
00054         typedef pointer           iterator;
00055         typedef const_pointer     const_iterator;
00056 
00057     public:
00058         // -----------
00059         // operator ==
00060         // -----------
00061 
00066         friend bool operator == (const Matrix& lhs, const Matrix& rhs) {
00067             size_type row = lhs.end() - lhs.begin();
00068                 for(unsigned int i=0; i<row; ++i){
00069                         if(lhs[i]!=rhs[i]) return false;
00070                         }
00071             return true;
00072             }
00073         
00074         // ----------
00075         // operator <
00076         // ----------
00077 
00082         friend bool operator < (const Matrix& lhs, const Matrix& rhs) {
00083             size_type row = lhs.end() - lhs.begin();
00084                 for(unsigned int i=0; i<row; ++i){
00085                         if(lhs[i]>=rhs[i]) return false;
00086                         }
00087             return true;
00088             }
00089         // ----------
00090         // operator +
00091         // ----------
00092 
00097         friend Matrix operator + (Matrix lhs, const T& rhs) {
00098             return lhs += rhs;}
00099 
00100         // ----------
00101         // operator +
00102         // ----------
00103 
00108         friend Matrix operator + (Matrix lhs, const Matrix& rhs) {
00109             return lhs += rhs;}
00110 
00111         // ----------
00112         // operator -
00113         // ----------
00114 
00119         friend Matrix operator - (Matrix lhs, const T& rhs) {
00120             return lhs -= rhs;}
00121 
00122         // ----------
00123         // operator -
00124         // ----------
00125 
00130         friend Matrix operator - (Matrix lhs, const Matrix& rhs) {
00131             return lhs -= rhs;}
00132 
00133         // ----------
00134         // operator *
00135         // ----------
00136 
00141         friend Matrix operator * (Matrix lhs, const T& rhs) {
00142             return lhs *= rhs;}
00143 
00144         // ----------
00145         // operator /
00146         // ----------
00147 
00148         /*
00149          *dividing each element of the matrix  by a T value of the rhs 
00150          * of the operator
00151          * @throws invalid_argument if (rhs == 0)
00152          */
00153         friend Matrix operator / (Matrix lhs, const T& rhs) {
00154             return lhs /= rhs;}
00155 
00156         // ----------
00157         // operator %
00158         // ----------
00159 
00165         friend Matrix operator % (Matrix lhs, const T& rhs) {
00166             return lhs %= rhs;}

00168 //template <typename T, std::size_t R, std::size_t C, typename A = std::allocator<T> >
00169     private:
00170         typedef typename allocator_type::template rebind<value_type>::other rebinded_alc_type;
00171         rebinded_alc_type mal;
00172         char co[sizeof (value_type) * R / sizeof(char)];
00173         pointer m;
00174 
00175     public:
00176         // ------------
00177         // constructors
00178         // ------------
00179         explicit Matrix(const T& v = T()){
00180             m = reinterpret_cast<pointer>(co);
00181             uninit_fill(this->mal, m, m + R, value_type(v));
00182             }
00186         explicit Matrix (const value_type& v = value_type()) : mal() {
00187             m = reinterpret_cast<pointer>(co);
00188             uninit_fill(this->mal, m, m + R, v);
00189             }
00190         /*
00191          *Copy Constructor
00192          */
00193         Matrix (const Matrix& that){
00194            this->mal = that.mal;
00195            m = reinterpret_cast<pointer>(co);
00196            uninit_copy(this->mal, that.begin(), that.end(), m);
00197         }
00198         /*
00199          *Copy Assignment
00200          */
00201          Matrix& operator= (const Matrix& that){
00202          mal = that.mal;
00203          std::copy(that.begin(), that.end(), m);
00204          return *this;
00205          }
00206         
00207         /*
00208          *Destructor
00209          */
00210          ~Matrix(){
00211             destroyer(mal, m, m + R);
00212          }
00213 
00214         // Default copy, destructor, and copy assignment.
00215         // Matrix (const Matrix&);
00216         // ~Matrix ();
00217         // Matrix& operator = (const Matrix&);

00227             // <your code>
00228            return m[i];
00229         }
00233         const_reference operator [] (size_type i) const {
00234             // <your code>
00235             // you must call the non-const operator[]()
00236             // dummy is just to be able to compile the skeleton, remove it
00237             return const_cast<Matrix&>(*this)[i];}

00246         Matrix& operator += (const T& rhs) {
00247             for(unsigned int i=0; i < R; i++){
00248                 for(unsigned int j=0; j < C; j++){
00249                         m[i][j] += rhs;
00250                         }
00251                 }
00252             return *this;}
00253

00262             for(unsigned int i=0; i < R; i++){
00263                 for(unsigned int j=0; j < C; j++){
00264                         m[i][j] += rhs[i][j];
00265                         }
00266                 }
00267             return *this;}

00277                 for(unsigned int j=0; j < C; j++){
00278                         m[i][j] -= rhs;
00279                         }
00280                 }

00291             for(unsigned int i=0; i < R; i++){
00292                 for(unsigned int j=0; j < C; j++){
00293                         m[i][j] -= rhs[i][j];
00294                         }
00295                 }
00296             return *this;}

00299         // operator *=

00305         Matrix& operator *= (const T& rhs) {
00306             for(unsigned int i=0; i < R; i++){
00307                 for(unsigned int j=0; j < C; j++){
00308                         m[i][j] *= rhs;
00309                         }
00310                 }
00311             return *this;}
00312 
00313         // -----------
00314         // operator /=
00315         // -----------
00316 
00321         Matrix& operator /= (const T& rhs) {
00322           if(rhs == 0)
00323                 throw std::invalid_argument("Matrix /= operator::invalid args");
00324             for(unsigned int i=0; i < R; i++){
00325                 for(unsigned int j=0; j < C; j++){
00326                         m[i][j] /= rhs;
00327                         }
00328                 }
00329             return *this;}
00330 
00331         // -----------
00332         // operator %=
00333         // -----------
00334 
00339         Matrix& operator %= (const T& rhs) {
00340           if(rhs == 0)
00341                 throw std::invalid_argument("Matrix %= operator::invalid args");
00342             for(unsigned int i=0; i < R; i++){
00343                 for(unsigned int j=0; j < C; j++){
00344                         m[i][j] %= rhs;
00345                         }
00346                 }
00347             return *this;}
00348 
00349         // -----
00350         // apply
00351         // -----
00352 
00357         template <typename UF>
00358         Matrix& apply (UF f) {
00359             for(unsigned int i=0; i < R; i++){
00360                 for(unsigned int j=0; j < C; j++){
00361                         m[i][j] = f(m[i][j]);
00362                         }
00363                 }
00364             return *this;}
00365 
00366         // --
00367         // at
00368         // --
00369 
00373         reference at (size_type i) {
00374             if(i<0 || i>= R){
00375                 throw std::out_of_range("My::Matrix.at(i) invalid args");
00376                 }
00377             return m[i];}
00378 
00382         const_reference at (size_type i) const {
00383             // you must call the non-const at()a
00384             return const_cast<Matrix&>(*this).at(i);}
00385 
00386         // -----
00387         // begin
00388         // -----
00389 
00393         iterator begin () {
00394             return m;}
00395 
00399         const_iterator begin () const {
00400             // you must call the non-const begin()
00401             return const_cast<Matrix&>(*this).begin();}
00402 
00403         // ---
00404         // end
00405         // ---
00406 
00410         iterator end () {
00411             return m + R;}
00412 
00416         const_iterator end () const {
00417             // you must call the non-const end()
00418             return const_cast<Matrix&>(*this).end();}
00419 
00420         // ----

00423 
00427         size_type size () const {
00428             return R * C;}
00429             
00430         size_type rows() const{
00431             return R;

00435             return C;
00436         }

00446 template <typename T, std::size_t R, std::size_t C, typename A, typename UF>
00447 Matrix<T, R, C> apply (Matrix<T, R, C, A> x, UF f) {
00448     return x.apply(f);}
